conclusion: Two cars, Car A and Car B, are traveling in the same direction on a straight highway with given vt graphs.
The image shows two velocity-time graphs for Cars A and B. Car A's velocity curve becomes less steep, Car B's becomes steeper.
For Car A, the velocity increases over time with a decreasing slope, indicating decreasing acceleration.
For Car B, the velocity decreases over time with an increasing slope, indicating increasing acceleration.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity.
If the slope of the velocity-time graph increases, it indicates that the acceleration is increasing.
During t=0 to t=t1, Car A experiences decreasing acceleration, Car B experiences increasing acceleration.
